Articles.Content:
So, I was on a generic mission to Minmus to plant a flag, and I noticed something strange. Lines. As I was coming to land, the popped into view. I was honestly, confused. I got closer, and they didn't disappear. I landed, and flew there using the EVA Jetpack. I took a sample, and an EVA Report. The sample said it tasted nothing like a frozen mint dessert. I thought, strange, if it doesn't taste like a dessert, what is Minmus really? My bets on a HUGE spaceship, all welded into one part (which explains the no lag), and the reason it looks like a frozen ball of water is because the inhabitants of "Minmus" need only water to survive. The gravity is made from all the metal inside Minmus to support the massive amount of frozen water at the outer hull. 

Whoops forgot the picture

[http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=438556217](http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=438556217)

Do you believe me? I already got my tinfoil, I'll make the hat tomorrow.

\*puts on tinfoil space helmet\*

that just proves it, Minmus was built by the Kiluminati!
That is a bit weird. I've not seen that before.

This happened while returning from a Mun flyby.

![s7bM1Iw.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/s7bM1Iw.jpg)

Took some juggling with map view to force a redraw that fixed the glitch.

That's obviously not a real photo. You probably faked that on a computer.

There's no evidence that the Minmus landing ever actually happened.

razark be realistic here, where would they find a big enough studio?

There's only one answer.

![maxresdefault.jpg](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/UBZ_4oUEQDg/maxresdefault.jpg)
Please provide the coordinates of your discovery! I must send a mission to confirm the lines at once!

> 
> \*puts on tinfoil space helmet\*
> that just proves it, Minmus was built by the Kiluminati!

Don't speak their name!

Jet fuel can't melt steel beams !!!

Wait, wrong thread...

> 
> razark be realistic here, where would they find a big enough studio?
> There's only one answer.
> 
> [http://i.ytimg.com/vi/UBZ_4oUEQDg/maxresdefault.jpg](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/UBZ_4oUEQDg/maxresdefault.jpg)

Oh come on, everyone knows they built a sound stage on Duna only for that.

> 
> This happened while returning from a Mun flyby.
> [http://i.imgur.com/s7bM1Iw.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/s7bM1Iw.jpg)
> 
> Took some juggling with map view to force a redraw that fixed the glitch.

Oh my, Kerbin is... hatching?

> 
> Jet fuel can't melt steel beams !!!
> Wait, wrong thread...

Correct. But structural steel loses the majority of strength long before melting. And by structural steel I of course mean M-beams.

> Oh my, Kerbin is... hatching?

It totally is. Quick, evacuate all kerbals. 

If we're lucky, the interdimensional being that hatches will lay a new planet, similar in size and composition to today's Kerbin.

It's interdimensional, so it can draw mass and energy from other places and stuff like that.

I have a tinfoil hat left over from my days in the Nimona comment section someone can borrow if they want. 

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-07T15:45:42Z" title="05/07/2015 03:45  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 7, 2015</time> by Tw1**

26,18' 38" N 

29, 46' 50" E

Sorry for not responding earlier, I had to go to bed.
Bum bum ba dum dum dum dun dun dun ba bum da dum da dum dum DUM

> 
> Bum bum ba dum dum dum dun dun dun ba bum da dum da dum dum DUM

Hal, open the pod bay door.
Looks like the rover tracks listed in the Easter Egg Stocktake thread.

>

Really? Never thought it was that good of an easter egg...

No problemo! I'll try and squeeze a mission in as I'm working on other important Space projects :3

> 
> This happened while returning from a Mun flyby.
> [http://i.imgur.com/s7bM1Iw.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/s7bM1Iw.jpg)
> 
> Took some juggling with map view to force a redraw that fixed the glitch.

 I've seen a similar thing. Once I got within 120,000km the planet redrew itself and everything was fine. Weird thing is, it only happened on that one flight, and didn't happen again for the rest of the day. I was going to file a report, but decided not to when it didn't recur.

> 
> Oh come on, everyone knows they built a sound stage on Duna only for that.
> Oh my, Kerbin is... hatching?

Nah, it's just plate tectonics.

> 
> Nah, it's just plate tectonics.

There was a 9.5 Kerbquake there, and...nobody died, there's only like 100 kerbals and they all live at the space center.

> 
> So, I was on a generic mission to Minmus to plant a flag, and I noticed something strange. Lines. As I was coming to land, the popped into view. I was honestly, confused. I got closer, and they didn't disappear. I landed, and flew there using the EVA Jetpack. I took a sample, and an EVA Report. The sample said it tasted nothing like a frozen mint dessert. I thought, strange, if it doesn't taste like a dessert, what is Minmus really? My bets on a HUGE spaceship, all welded into one part (which explains the no lag), and the reason it looks like a frozen ball of water is because the inhabitants of "Minmus" need only water to survive. The gravity is made from all the metal inside Minmus to support the massive amount of frozen water at the outer hull.

I'm pretty sure that's been there since 0.23.5

One of my rovers died horribly not too far from one of these artifacts.
I go for the rovertracks :-D

> 
> I'm pretty sure that's been there since 0.23.5
> One of my rovers died horribly not too far from one of these artifacts.

Really? I still got my theory, so we'll never know.
It almost looks like lights. Did you look above this when you were investigating? Or below?
